meta.purpose: UI/UX component library mockup showing shared components, navigation, modals, forms, and various states
meta.notes_for_model: This is a design system component sheet showing all the reusable UI components in the Family TV Guide app. It should display components in their various states and serve as a reference for the overall design language.

story.one_sentence_brief: A comprehensive UI component library sheet displaying navigation bars (desktop top and mobile bottom), buttons in all states, form inputs, modals, toast notifications, card components, badges, loading skeletons, and empty states - all following the warm cinema aesthetic.
story.additional_context: This serves as a design system reference showing how all UI components look and behave. It's essential for maintaining consistency across the app and for developer handoff.

scene.subject: A organized component library sheet showing: TOP ROW - Navigation components (desktop glass top nav with logo and links, mobile bottom nav bar with icons). SECOND ROW - Button variants (primary gold, secondary outline, ghost, destructive) in default, hover, and disabled states. THIRD ROW - Form elements (text input with floating label, select dropdown, checkbox, radio, toggle switch). FOURTH ROW - Modal example with overlay, card structures (poster card, episode card, profile card). FIFTH ROW - Toast notifications (success, info, warning, error), loading states (skeleton, spinner), and an empty state illustration.
secondary_subjects: Desktop navigation with FTV logo, Tonight/Schedule/Library links, profile avatar
Mobile bottom nav with four icon+label items
Gold primary buttons with glow effect
Glassmorphic input fields with gold focus borders
Modal with overlay showing dialog structure
Toast notifications with colored left borders and icons
Skeleton loaders with shimmer animation suggestion
Empty state with illustration and CTA
scene.action: Static design system sheet showing all components in organized rows/sections
scene.location: Design system documentation layout - organized grid of component examples
scene.mood: Organized and systematic, like a well-documented design system - clarity and consistency

composition.framing: Components organized in logical sections/rows with labels. Each component shown with multiple states where applicable. Dark background with components displayed on slightly lighter sections.

style.era_or_reference: Modern design system documentation like Figma component libraries - organized, labeled, comprehensive
style.color_palette: Deep night background (#0D0F14), cinema gold for primary actions (#D4A853), sage green for success (#4CAF7C), amber for warning (#E89B3C), coral for error (#CF5C5C), teal for info (#2D8B8B), elevated surfaces for cards (#1C2230), warm white text

lighting.description: Flat, even lighting for clear component visibility. Each component is clearly separated with consistent backgrounds. No dramatic lighting - focus on clarity.
lighting.color_and_contrast: High contrast for all text elements. Component states clearly differentiated through color and opacity changes.

format.surface_or_output: Design system documentation sheet, suitable for design handoff
